Description: Long, thin sandstone whetstone (?), with square cross-section. One end is flat, the other tapering off to a point; all edges are slightly blunt.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, Findspot 52 W (west?), south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops. (?)
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but certainly from Tell Dafana according to the context of the item in the list, the similarity of material and shape with London, BM, EA 23822 and 18542, Boston, MFA, RES.87.126 and Bolton, 1886.28.28, and the number "52 W" pencilled on the item, which indicates a provenance from Findspot 52 (west?), south-eastern quarter of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp"), area of ironsmith's workshops. The object is one of the "large number of tapering square whetstones of sandstone ... found in the Camp", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 70.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.78, p.185, pl.27)
